<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt" align=center><B>PROXY 
STATEMENT<BR>
as at August 18, 2016</B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; page-break-before:always"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt" align=center><b>BRAVO MULTINATIONAL INCORPORATED</b><BR>
<B>590 York Road, Unit 3</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt" align=center><B>Niagara On The 
Lake, Ontario, L0S 1J0, CANADA<BR>
Telephone (716) 803-0621</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt" align=center>August 18, 2016</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt" align=justify>To Our 
Stockholders:</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; text-indent:36pt">You are 
cordially invited to attend the 2016 Annual Meeting of the Stockholders of Bravo
Multinational Incorporated, which will be held at 11:00 a.m., Eastern Time, on 
September 29, 2016, at 30 North Park Road, Thornhill, Ontario, CANADA (the 
&#147;2016 Annual Meeting&#148;).</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; text-indent:36pt">At the 2016 
Annual Meeting, we will give a current report on our business, comment on 
matters of interest and respond to your questions. &nbsp;You will find 
information regarding the matters to be voted on in the attached Notice of 
Annual Meeting of Stockholders and Proxy Statement. &nbsp;In addition, we will 
introduce attendees to our directors and senior leadership. &nbsp;A copy of our 
2015 Annual Report on Form 10-K/A, including the financial statements, schedules
and list of exhibits, is enclosed with this Proxy Statement.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">Pursuant to 
rules promulgated by the Securities and Exchange Commission, we have elected to 
provide access to our Proxy Materials over the Internet. &nbsp;Accordingly, our 
stockholders who held our shares as of the close of business on August 1, 2016, 
the &#147;Record Date&#148; for the 2016 Annual Meeting, will receive a Notice 
of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials (the &#147;Notice of Internet 
Availability&#148;) describing how to access our Proxy Materials over the 
Internet on a website referred to in the Notice of Internet Availability or 
request to receive a printed or emailed set of Proxy Materials. &nbsp;These 
Proxy Materials will be available free of charge.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">Whether you own 
few or many shares of stock, it is important that your shares be represented and
voted at the 2016 Annual Meeting. &nbsp;Stockholders can vote their shares by 
telephone or on the Internet. &nbsp;Instructions for using these convenient 
services are provided in the Proxy Statement. &nbsp;You also can vote your 
shares by requesting a paper proxy card and completing, signing and returning it
by mail. &nbsp;The individuals named in the proxy card are our chairman and one 
of our directors. &nbsp;A stockholder wishing to appoint some other person (who 
needs not be a stockholder of Bravo Multinational Incorporated) to represent him
at the meeting has the right to do so, either by inserting such person&#146;s 
name in the blank space provided in the form of proxy or by completing another 
form of proxy. &nbsp;If you decide to attend the meeting, you will be able to 
vote in person, even if you previously have voted by another means.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">If you are 
unable to attend the 2016 Annual Meeting, it is important that you timely vote 
your shares in advance, using one of the procedures mentioned above and as more 
fully described in the Proxy Statement. &nbsp;If you have any questions or need 
assistance in voting your shares, please call our corporate secretary, Mr. 
Richard Kaiser at (716) 803-0621, or email him at info@bravomultinational.com, 
or contact him by mail at 3419 Virginia Beach Boulevard, Unit 252, Virginia 
Beach, Virginia 23452.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">We look forward 
to your participation in the 2016 Annual Meeting.</P>
<P style="margin-top:11.25pt; margin-bottom:0pt; padding-left:252pt">Very truly 
yours,</P>
<P style="line-height:11.25pt; margin:0pt"><BR>
<P style="margin:0pt; text-indent:252pt" align=justify>/s/</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; text-indent:252pt" align=justify>Paul Parliament,</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:252pt" align=justify><I>Chairman and Chief 
Executive Officer</I></P>
<P style="margin:0pt" align=center><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P align="center" style="margin:0pt"><BR>
i</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; page-break-before:always"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:6pt" align=center><b>BRAVO MULTINATIONAL
INCORPORATED</b><BR>
<B>590 York Road, Unit 3<BR>
Niagara On The Lake, Ontario, L0S 1J0, CANADA<BR>
Telephone (716) 803-0621</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:6pt" align=center>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt" align=center><B>NOTICE OF ANNUAL 
MEETING OF STOCKHOLDERS
TO BE HELD ON SEPTEMBER 29, 2016</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt">To the Stockholders of Bravo 
Multinational Incorporated:</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">Notice is hereby
given that the 2016 Annual Meeting of the Stockholders of Bravo Multinational 
Incorporated (sometimes &#147;Bravo&#148;) will be held at 11:00 a.m., Eastern 
Time, on September 29, 2016, at 30 North Park Road, Thornhill, Ontario, CANADA 
(the &#147;2016 Annual Meeting&#148;), for the following purposes:</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; text-indent:-
18pt">1.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:36pt">To elect three 
persons as directors to our board of directors as described in the attached 
Proxy Statement (Proposal 1);</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; text-indent:-
18pt">2.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:36pt">To ratify the 
amendment and restatement of our bylaws adopted by our directors and 
stockholders on September 25, 2015, as described in the attached Proxy Statement
(Proposal 2);</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; text-indent:-
18pt">3.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:36pt">To ratify the 
amendment and restatement of our certificate of incorporation adopted by our 
directors and stockholders on September 25, 2015, and filed with the Secretary 
of State of Delaware on September 25, 2015, and as submitted to our directors on
July 20, 2016, for ratification by our stockholders, as described in the 
attached Proxy Statement (Proposal 3);</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; text-indent:-
18pt">4.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:36pt">To ratify the 
Bravo Multinational Incorporated Employees, Officers, Directors, and Consultants
Stock Plan for the Year 2016, adopted by our directors on March 18, 2016, and
amended on March 21, 2016 (the &#147;2016 Plan&#148;), with 50,000,000 shares of
our common stock in the aggregate authorized for issuance under the Plan, as 
described in the attached Proxy Statement (Proposal 4);</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; text-indent:-
18pt">5.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:36pt">To ratify the 
selection of Scrudato &amp; Co. CPA as our independent registered public 
accounting firm for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2016, , as described in 
the attached Proxy Statement (Proposal 5); and</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; text-indent:-
18pt">6.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:36pt">To transact 
such other business as may properly come before the 2016 Annual Meeting or any 
adjournment or postponement thereof.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">The board of 
directors has fixed the close of business on August 1, 2016, as the Record Date 
for the determination of stockholders entitled to notice of and to vote at the 
2016 Annual Meeting. &nbsp;A list of the stockholders will be available for 
inspection for at least 10 days prior to the meeting during normal business 
hours at Bravo&#146;s executive offices located at 590 York Road, Unit 3, 
Niagara On The Lake, Ontario, L0S 1J0, CANADA.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">If you would 
like to vote at the 2016 Annual Meeting, you must bring a form of personal 
identification. If your shares are held by a broker, bank or other nominee, you 
also must bring a letter from the nominee confirming your beneficial ownership 
of such shares and, if you intend to vote the shares, a proxy permitting you to 
vote the shares.</P>
<P align="center" style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:pt">By
Order of the Board of Directors,</P>
<P align="center" style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:02pt; padding-
left:pt">/s/ Paul Parliament,</P>
<P align="center" style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-
left:pt"><I>Chairman and Chief Executive Officer</I></P>
<P style="margin:0pt" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt" align=justify>Niagara On The Lake, Ontario</P>
<P style="margin:0pt">August 18, 2016</P>
<P style="line-height:11.25pt; margin:0pt"><BR></P>

<P style="margin:0pt" align=center><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt"><B>IT IS IMPORTANT THAT YOUR SHARES BE REPRESENTED AND 
VOTED AT THE 2016 ANNUAL MEETING. &nbsp;YOU CAN SUBMIT A PROXY BY TELEPHONE OR 
THE INTERNET. &nbsp;ALTERNATIVELY, YOU MAY REQUEST A PAPER PROXY CARD, WHICH YOU
MAY COMPLETE, SIGN AND RETURN BY MAIL.</B></P>

<P style="line-height:8pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:6pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman Bold; font-size:11pt" align=center><FONT FACE="Times New Roman 
Bold"><B>PROXY STATEMENT</B></FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt" align=center><FONT FACE="Times New
Roman"><B>________________</B></FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:8pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:6pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman Bold; font-size:11pt" align=center><FONT FACE="Times New Roman 
Bold"><B>ANNUAL MEETING OF STOCKHOLDERS
TO BE HELD SEPTEMBER 29, 2016</B></FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt" align=center><FONT FACE="Times New
Roman"><B>________________</B></FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:5pt" align=center><B>INFORMATION 
CONCERNING SOLICITATION AND VOTING</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:5pt" align=center>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">This Proxy 
Statement and the accompanying Proxy Materials are furnished in connection with 
the solicitation of proxies by the board of directors of Bravo Multinational 
Incorporated (sometimes &#147;Bravo,&#148; &#147;our&#148; or &#147;we&#148;), a
Delaware corporation, to be voted at the 2016 annual meeting of stockholders to 
be held at 11:00 a.m., Eastern Time, on September 29, 2016, at 30 North Park 
Road, Thornhill, Ontario, CANADA, and at any and all adjournments thereof (the 
&#147;2016 Annual Meeting&#148;).</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">Our website is 
located at www.bravomultinational.com. &nbsp;References to our website in this 
Proxy Statement are inactive textual references only and the contents of our 
website are not incorporated by reference into this Proxy Statement for any 
purpose.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">In accordance 
with the rules and regulations of the Securities and Exchange Commission, 
instead of mailing a printed copy of our Proxy Materials to each stockholder, we
are furnishing Proxy Materials to our stockholders via the Internet. &nbsp;If 
you received a &#147;Notice of Internet Availability,&#148; you will not receive
a printed copy of the Proxy Materials unless you specifically request a printed 
copy. &nbsp;Instead, the Notice of Internet Availability will instruct you how 
to access and review all of the important information contained in the Proxy 
Materials. &nbsp;The Notice of Internet Availability also instructs you how to 
submit your proxy on the Internet and how to vote by telephone. &nbsp;If you 
would like to receive a printed or emailed copy of our Proxy Materials, you 
should follow the instructions for requesting such materials included in the 
Notice of Internet Availability.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">The Notice of 
Internet Availability is first being sent to stockholders on or about August 18,
2016. &nbsp;Also on or about August 18, 2016, we will first make available to 
our stockholders this Proxy Statement and the form of proxy relating to the 2016
Annual Meeting, as well as our Annual Report on Form 10-K/A for the year ended 
December 31, 2015, filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on April 
28, 2016, which we refer to in this Proxy Statement as the &#147;2015 Annual 
Report.&#148;</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt" align=justify><B>Proxy 
Solicitation and Costs</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">Bravo will pay 
the expenses of the solicitation of proxies by our board of directors. 
&nbsp;Proxies can be solicited on our behalf by directors, officers or 
employees, without additional remuneration, in person or by telephone, by mail, 
electronic transmission and facsimile transmission. &nbsp;Solicitation of 
proxies by mail is expected to commence on August 18, 2016. &nbsp;We have hired 
Broadridge Financial Solutions, Inc., to distribute and solicit proxies. 
&nbsp;We will pay Broadridge Financial Solutions, Inc. a fee of approximately 
$2,500.00, plus reasonable out-of-pocket expenses, for its services.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">Brokers, banks, 
trustees and other nominees will be requested to make available proxy-soliciting
material to the owners of common stock held in their names and, as required by 
law, Bravo will reimburse them for their reasonable out-of-pocket expenses for
this service.
<BR></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0pt; font-size:12pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt" align=center>1</P>
<P style="margin:0pt"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; page-break-before:always"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt" align=justify><B>Dissenters&#146; 
Right of Appraisal</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">No action will 
be taken in connection with the proposals by our board of directors or the 
voting stockholders for which Delaware law, our certificate of incorporation or 
bylaws provide a right of a stockholder to dissent and obtain appraisal of or 
payment for such stockholder&#146;s shares.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt" align=justify><B>How Proxies 
Work</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">Bravo&#146;s 
board of directors is asking for your proxy. &nbsp;Giving us your proxy means 
that you authorize us to vote your shares at the 2016 Annual Meeting in the 
manner that you direct, or if you do not direct us, in the manner as recommended
by the board of directors in this Proxy Statement. &nbsp;You can vote for the 
director nominees or withhold your vote for one or all nominees. &nbsp;You also 
can vote for or against the other proposals or abstain from voting. &nbsp;If you
request a proxy card, and return your signed proxy card, but do not give voting 
instructions, the shares represented by that proxy will be voted &#147;FOR&#148;
each proposal as recommended by the board of directors. &nbsp;The individuals 
named in the proxy card are our chairman and one of our directors. &nbsp;A 
stockholder wishing to appoint some other person (who needs not be a stockholder
of Bravo Multinational Incorporated) to represent him at the meeting has the 
right to do so, either by inserting such person&#146;s name in the blank space 
provided in the form of proxy or by completing another form of proxy.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt" align=justify><B>Stockholders 
Entitled To Vote</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">Stockholders of 
record at the close of business on August 1, 2016 (the &#147;Record Date&#148;),
are entitled to notice of and to vote at the 2016 Annual Meeting and at any 
adjournments thereof. &nbsp;On the Record Date, our authorized capital stock 
consisted of 1,000,000,000 shares of common stock, par value $0.0001 per share, 
and 5,000,000 shares of preferred stock, par value $0.0001 per share. &nbsp;Each
share of the common stock is entitled to one vote on each matter properly 
brought before the 2016 Annual Meeting. &nbsp;In addition, the holders of our 
Series A preferred stock have the voting rights as discussed below.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">As of the Record
Date, 371,300,924 shares of our common stock were outstanding, fully paid and 
non-assessable. &nbsp;Each share of the common stock outstanding entitles the 
holder to one vote on all matters brought before the common stockholders. 
&nbsp;In addition, as of the Record Date, 5,000,000 shares of the Series A 
preferred stock of Bravo were issued and outstanding. &nbsp;Pursuant to our 
Certificate of Designation establishing the Series A preferred stock, a holder 
of shares of the Series A preferred stock is entitled to the number of votes of 
the holders of common stock equal to the number of shares of the Series A 
preferred stock held by such holder multiplied by 100 on all matters submitted 
to a vote of our stockholders. &nbsp;Therefore, the holders of our Series A 
preferred stock have the power to vote 500,000,000 shares of our common stock, 
which is more than the total outstanding shares of our common stock as of the 
Record Date.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">This summary of 
the voting rights of our Series A preferred stock is, however, qualified in its 
entirety by and subject to the more complete information set forth in our 
Certificate of Designation establishing the Series A preferred stock filed with 
the Secretary of State of Delaware on March 24, 2015, a copy of which is 
attached hereto as <U>Annex A</U><I>.</I> &nbsp;You may obtain a copy of our
Certificate of Designation establishing the Series A preferred stock by 
accessing this Proxy Statement as filed with the Securities and Exchange 
Commission on the Internet at www.sec.gov or by clicking on the Securities and 
Exchange Commission Filings link on the Investor Relations section of our 
website at www.bravomultinational.com, or by contacting Mr. Richard Kaiser, our 
corporate secretary, at 3419 Virginia Beach Boulevard, Unit 252, Virginia Beach,
Virginia 23452, telephone (757) 306-6090, or email him at 
info@bravomultinational.com.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt" align=center><BR>

stockholders&#148;) hold 183,936,299 shares of our common stock and 5,000,000 
shares of our Series A preferred stock:</P>

<P style="line-height:10pt; margin:0pt; font-family:Dutch801 Rm BT; font-
size:8pt"><FONT FACE="Dutch801 Rm BT">__________</FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-10pt; padding-
left:18pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-size:8pt"><FONT FACE="Times New 
Roman">(1)</FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin:0pt; padding-left:18pt; font-size:8pt">Unless
otherwise indicated, the address for each of these stockholders is c/o Bravo 
Multinational Incorporated, 590 York Road, Unit 3, Niagara On The Lake, Ontario,
L0S 1J0, CANADA. Also, unless otherwise indicated, each person named in the 
table above has the sole voting and investment power with respect to our shares 
of common stock or preferred stock which he beneficially owns.</P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-10pt; padding-
left:18pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-size:8pt">(2)</P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin:0pt; padding-left:18pt; font-
size:8pt">Beneficial ownership is determined in accordance with the rules of the
Securities and Exchange Commission. &nbsp;As of August 1, 2016, there were 
outstanding 371,300,924 shares of our common stock. &nbsp;As of August 1, 2016, 
we have 5,000,000 shares of the Series A preferred stock issued and outstanding.
&nbsp;Each share of the Series A preferred stock has voting rights equal to 100 
shares of our common stock. &nbsp;Further, each share of the Series A preferred 
stock may be converted into 10 shares of our common stock. &nbsp;However, there 
are restrictions on the conversion rights of the Series A preferred stock as 
stated elsewhere in this Proxy Statement. &nbsp;See <U>Annex A</U> attached to 
this Proxy Statement.</P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-10pt; padding-
left:18pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-size:8pt">(3)</P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin:0pt; padding-left:18pt; font-size:8pt">Mr. 
Parliament is our chairman of the board of the directors, chief executive 
officer, president and a director.</P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-10pt; padding-
left:18pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-size:8pt">(4)</P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin:0pt; padding-left:18pt; font-size:8pt">Mr. 
Wolfe is our chief financial officer, principal accounting officer, treasurer, 
and a director. &nbsp;Pursuant an Assignment of Voting Rights dated December 31,
2015, Jack Frydman assigned to Martin Wolfe all voting rights possessed by Mr. 
Frydman in the 250,000 shares of the Series A preferred stock of Bravo 
Multinational Incorporated owned by Mr. Frydman. &nbsp;See Footnote 8, below. 
&nbsp;Mr. Wolfe has declined to stand for reelection as a director, due to 
personal reasons.</P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-10pt; padding-
left:18pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-size:8pt">(5)</P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin:0pt; padding-left:18pt; font-size:8pt">Mr. 
Brooks is our vice president and a director.</P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-10pt; padding-
left:18pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-size:8pt">(6)</P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin:0pt; padding-left:18pt; font-size:8pt">Mr. 
Kaiser is our corporate secretary and corporate governance officer, and a 
nominee for director.</P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-10pt; padding-
left:18pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-size:8pt">(7)</P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin:0pt; padding-left:18pt; font-size:8pt">Mr. 
Kosta is a stockholder. </P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-10pt; padding-
left:18pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-size:8pt">(8)</P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin:0pt; padding-left:18pt; font-size:8pt">Mr. 
Frydman is a stockholder. &nbsp;Pursuant an Assignment of Voting Rights dated 
December 31, 2015, Jack Frydman assigned to Martin Wolfe all voting rights 
possessed by Mr. Frydman in the 250,000 shares of the Series A preferred stock 
of Bravo Multinational Incorporated owned by Mr. Frydman. &nbsp;You may obtain a
copy of Assignment of Voting Rights by accessing this Proxy Statement as filed 
with the Securities and Exchange Commission on the Internet at www.sec.gov or by
clicking on the Securities and Exchange Commission Filings link on the Investor 
Relations section of our website at www.bravomultinational.com, or by contacting
Mr. Richard Kaiser, our corporate secretary, at 3419 Virginia Beach Boulevard, 
Unit 252, Virginia Beach, Virginia 23452, telephone (757) 306-6090, or email him
at info@bravomultinational.com.</P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-10pt; padding-
left:18pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-size:8pt">(9)</P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:8pt; padding-
left:18pt; font-size:8pt">Bravo Gaming Corporation, a Nevada corporation, is our
wholly-owned subsidiary.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">Therefore, the 
controlling stockholders will have the power to vote 683,936,299 shares of our 
common stock, which number exceeds the majority of the 371,300,924 issued and 
outstanding shares of the common stock on the Record Date. &nbsp;The controlling
stockholders will vote in favor of the above described proposals, and will have 
the power to pass the proposed corporate actions without the concurrence of any 
of our other stockholders.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">Most of our 
stockholders hold their shares through a stockbroker, bank, trustee or other 
nominee rather than directly in their own name. &nbsp;As summarized below, there
are some distinctions between shares held of record and those beneficially owned
in street name:</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol"><I>&#183;</I></FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:72pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman"><I>Stockholder of Record:</I></FONT> If your shares are 
registered directly in your name with Bravo&#146;s transfer agent, Transfer 
Online, Inc., you are considered the stockholder of record of those shares and
these Proxy Materials are being made available directly to you by Bravo. 
&nbsp;As the stockholder of record, you have the right to vote in person at the 
2016 Annual Meeting, or the right to grant your voting proxy directly to the 
individuals named in the proxy card, if one is requested, who are our chairman 
and one of our directors. &nbsp;A stockholder wishing to appoint some other 
person (who needs not be a stockholder of Bravo Multinational Incorporated) to 
represent him at the meeting has the right to do so, either by inserting such 
person&#146;s name in the blank space provided in the form of proxy or by 
completing another form of proxy.</P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0pt; font-size:12pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt" align=center>3</P>
<P style="margin:0pt"><BR>
</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; page-break-before:always"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol"><I>&#183;</I></FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:72pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman"><I>Beneficial Owner of Shares Held in Street 
Name:</I></FONT> If your shares are held in a brokerage account through a bank, 
broker, trustee or other nominee, you are considered the beneficial owner of 
shares held in street name and these Proxy Materials are being made available to
you through your bank, broker, trustee or nominee. &nbsp;As the beneficial owner
of shares held in street name, you have the right to direct your bank, broker, 
trustee, or nominee on how to vote and are also invited to attend the 2016 
Annual Meeting. &nbsp;Your bank, broker, trustee or nominee is obligated to 
provide you with voting instructions for use in instructing the bank, broker, 
trustee or nominee how to vote these shares. &nbsp;However, since you are not 
the stockholder of record, you may not vote these shares in person at the 
meeting unless you have obtained a legal proxy from your bank, broker, trustee 
or nominee entitling you to vote your shares at the 2016 Annual Meeting.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt" align=justify><B>How to 
Vote</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">You can vote in 
person at the 2016 Annual Meeting or by proxy. &nbsp;We recommend that you 
submit a proxy even if you plan to attend the 2016 Annual Meeting. &nbsp;You can
revoke your proxy and change your vote at the 2016 Annual Meeting in one of the 
ways described below. &nbsp;All shares represented by proxies that have been 
properly voted and not revoked will be voted at the 2016 Annual Meeting. </P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">We are offering 
stockholders four methods of voting:</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:72pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">You may vote over the Internet.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:72pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">You may vote by telephone.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:72pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">If you are a registered holder of our shares, you may 
request a paper proxy card from us, and indicate your vote by completing, 
signing and dating the card where indicated and by mailing or otherwise 
returning the card in the prepaid envelope accompanying the paper proxy card. 
&nbsp;As the stockholder of record, you have the right to vote in person at the 
2016 Annual Meeting, or the right to grant your voting proxy directly to the 
individuals named in the proxy card, if one is requested, who are our chairman 
and one of our directors. &nbsp;A stockholder wishing to appoint some other 
person (who needs not be a stockholder of Bravo Multinational Incorporated) to
represent him at the meeting has the right to do so, either by inserting such 
person&#146;s name in the blank space provided in the form of proxy or by 
completing another form of proxy.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:72pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">You may vote in person at the 2016 Annual Meeting. 
&nbsp;If you attend the 2016 Annual Meeting, you will be able to vote your 
shares, even if you already voted by Internet, telephone, or mail. 
&nbsp;However, if you are the beneficial owner of shares held in street name, 
you must obtain a proxy, executed in your favor, from the bank, broker, trustee 
or other nominee to be able to vote in person at the 2016 Annual Meeting. 
</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">If you cannot 
attend the 2016 Annual Meeting, it is important that you vote your shares in 
advance of the 2016 Annual Meeting, using one of the procedures described 
above.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt" align=justify><B>Revoking a 
Proxy</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">You can revoke 
your proxy, whether it was given by the Internet, telephone or mail, before it 
is voted by:</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:72pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">Submitting a new proxy with a later date, including a 
proxy given via the Internet or by telephone;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:72pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">Providing written notice to Mr. Richard Kaiser, our 
corporate secretary, at 3419 Virginia Beach Boulevard, Unit 252, Virginia Beach,
Virginia 23452, telephone (757) 306-6090, or email him at 
info@bravomultinational.com before or at the 2016 Annual Meeting prior to the 
voting on any proposal, if you are a registered holder of our shares; 
or</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0pt; font-size:12pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt" align=center>4</P>
<P style="margin:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; page-break-before:always"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:72pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">Voting by ballot at the 2016 Annual Meeting.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">The last vote 
you submit chronologically (by any means) will supersede your prior vote(s). 
&nbsp;Your attendance at the 2016 Annual Meeting will not, by itself, revoke 
your proxy.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt" align=justify><B>Quorum</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">In order to 
transact business at the 2016 Annual Meeting, we must have a quorum. &nbsp;This 
means that at least a majority of the issued and outstanding shares entitled to 
vote must be represented at the 2016 Annual Meeting, either by proxy or in 
person. &nbsp;Abstentions and broker non-votes (which are described below) are 
counted as present and entitled to vote for purposes of determining a quorum. 
&nbsp;Treasury shares, which are shares owned by Bravo itself, are not voted and
do not count towards establishing a quorum. &nbsp;If a quorum is not present, 
the meeting will be adjourned until a quorum is obtained.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt" align=justify><B>Votes 
Needed</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">The director 
nominees who receive the most votes at the meeting will be elected to fill the 
seats on Bravo&#146;s board of directors. &nbsp;Approval of the other proposals 
requires the favorable vote of a majority of the votes cast. &nbsp;Only votes 
for or against a proposal count as votes cast. &nbsp;Abstentions and broker non-
votes (which are described below) are not counted as votes cast and, therefore, 
will have no effect on the outcome of the matters to be voted on at the annual 
meeting. &nbsp;Votes will be tabulated by an independent inspector of elections 
appointed for the 2016 Annual Meeting, who will separately tabulate affirmative 
and negative votes, abstentions and broker non-votes. &nbsp;The preliminary 
voting results will be announced at the meeting. &nbsp;The final voting results 
will be tallied by the inspector of elections and reported in a Current Report 
on Form 8-K, which will be filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission 
within four business days after the 2016 Annual Meeting.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt" align=justify><B>Broker Non-
Votes</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">If you are a 
beneficial owner of shares held in street name and do not give voting 
instructions to your bank or brokerage firm, your bank or brokerage firm will be
able to vote your shares with respect to certain &#147;discretionary&#148; 
items, but will not be allowed to vote your shares with respect to certain 
&#147;non-discretionary&#148; items. &nbsp;The ratification of the appointment 
of our independent registered public accounting firm (Proposal 5) is considered 
to be a discretionary item on which banks and brokerage firms may vote. 
&nbsp;The election of directors (Proposal 1), the vote to ratify the amendment 
and restatement of our bylaws adopted by our directors and stockholders on 
September 25, 2015, as described in the attached Proxy Statement (Proposal 2), 
the vote to ratify the amendment and restatement of our certificate of 
incorporation adopted by our directors and stockholders on September 25, 2015, 
and filed with the Secretary of State of Delaware on September 25, 2015, and as 
submitted to our directors for ratification by our stockholders, as described in
the attached Proxy Statement (Proposal 3), and the vote to ratify the Bravo 
Multinational Incorporated Employees, Officers, Directors, and Consultants Stock
Plan for the Year 2016, adopted by our directors on March 18, 2016, and amended 
on March 21, 2016 (the &#147;2016 Plan&#148;), with 50,000,000 shares of our 
common stock in the aggregate authorized for issuance under the Plan, as 
described in the attached Proxy Statement (Proposal 4) are non-discretionary 
items on which your bank or brokerage firm may not vote without voting 
instructions from you. &nbsp;In the case of these non-discretionary items for 
which your bank or brokerage firm does not have voting instructions, the bank or
brokerage firm is required to indicate on its proxy that it does not have 
discretionary authority to vote on these matters, and your shares will be 
treated as &#147;broker non-votes&#148; with respect to these proposals.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt" align=justify><B>Conduct of the 
2016 Annual Meeting</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">Under our 
Amended and Restated By-Laws, the chairman of our board of directors may adopt 
rules and procedures that he believes are appropriate to ensure that the 2016 
Annual Meeting is conducted properly.</P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0pt; font-size:12pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt" align=center>5</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; page-break-before:always"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt" align=justify><B>Voting on Other 
Matters</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">If other matters
are properly presented at the 2016 Annual Meeting for consideration, the persons
named in the proxy will have the discretion to vote on those matters for you. 
&nbsp;As of the date of this Proxy Statement, we do not know of any other 
matters to be raised at the 2016 Annual Meeting and the dates by which other 
matters to be voted on at the 2016 Annual Meeting must have been submitted by 
our stockholders pursuant to Rule 14a-8 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934,
as amended (the &#147;Exchange Act&#148;) or our Amended and Restated By-Laws 
have passed.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt" align=justify><B>Householding of 
Annual Meeting Materials</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">Some 
stockholders may be participating in the practice of &#147;householding&#148; 
proxy statements, annual reports, and the Notice of Internet Availability. 
&nbsp;This means that only one copy of such documents may have been sent to 
multiple stockholders in your household. &nbsp;We will promptly deliver a 
separate copy of the Notice of Internet Availability, Proxy Statement or 2015 
Annual Report if you may contact Mr. Richard Kaiser, our corporate secretary, at
3419 Virginia Beach Boulevard, Unit 252, Virginia Beach, Virginia 23452, 
telephone (716) 803-0621, or email him at info@bravomultinational.com. &nbsp;If 
you want to receive separate copies of the Notice of Internet Availability, 
proxy statements and annual reports in the future, or if you are receiving 
multiple copies and would like to receive only one copy for your household, you 
should contact your bank, broker or other nominee record holder, or you may 
contact Mr. Richard Kaiser, our corporate secretary, at 3419 Virginia Beach 
Boulevard, Unit 252, Virginia Beach, Virginia 23452, telephone (716) 803-0621, 
or email him at info@bravomultinational.com.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt" align=center><B>ELECTION OF 
DIRECTORS<BR>
(PROPOSAL 1)</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">Three directors 
are to be elected at the 2016 Annual Meeting to hold office until their 
successors are elected. &nbsp;The board of directors is composed of three 
directors. &nbsp;At each annual meeting of stockholders, directors will be 
elected to hold office until their successors are elected. &nbsp;There are no 
family relationships among any of the directors, director nominees or the 
executive officers of Bravo.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">The board of 
directors has nominated Paul Parliament, Douglas Brooks, and Richard Kaiser to 
be elected at the 2016 Annual Meeting. &nbsp;Martin Wolfe, one of our current 
directors does not wish to stand for reelection due to personal reasons. 
&nbsp;Shares represented by executed proxies will be voted, if authority to do 
so is not withheld, for the election of the nominees named above. &nbsp;If, 
however, any of the proposed directors are unable to serve, or for good cause 
decline to serve at the time of the 2016 Annual Meeting, the proxy may be voted 
for a substitute nominee designated by the board of directors to fill the 
vacancy. &nbsp;Each person nominated for election has agreed to serve if 
elected, and Bravo has no reason to believe that any of the nominees for 
election will not be available to serve his prescribed term.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">The name of each
current director and the nominees for election as directors and certain 
background information about such persons as of the date hereof is set forth 
below.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt" align=justify><B>Vote 
Required</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">The affirmative 
vote of a plurality of the votes cast at the 2016 Annual Meeting is required to 
elect the three nominees as directors. &nbsp;This means that the three nominees 
will be elected if they receive more affirmative votes than any other 
person.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">The board of 
directors has unanimously approved the nominees for election as directors at the
2016 Annual Meeting and recommends that the stockholders vote &#147;For&#148; 
the election of the nominees listed below.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">The controlling 
stockholders will have the power to vote 683,936,299 shares of our common stock,
which number exceeds the majority of the 371,300,924 issued and outstanding 
shares of the common stock on the Record Date. &nbsp;The controlling 
stockholders will vote for the election of the nominees listed below.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0pt; font-size:12pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt" align=center>6</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; page-break-before:always"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt"><B>Nominees to Serve as 
Directors</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">Paul Parliament 
has been a member of our board since October 31, 2012. &nbsp;For the past ten 
years, Mr. Parliament served as president of The Parliament Corporation and six 
years as President of The Parliament Apartment Corporation, which were companies
in the real estate re-development business. &nbsp;Mr. Parliament has over 28 
years as a successful real estate developer, and as president of Marsadi Layne 
Properties, Inc., The Parliament Corporation, P.D.P Developments, Inc., and The 
Parliament Apartment Corporation. &nbsp;Mr. Parliament has knowledge of property
acquisitions, corporate finance, planning, permitting, staffing, management, and
strategic business planning.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">Douglas Brooks 
has been a member of our board since September 25, 2015. &nbsp;Mr. Brooks has 
had a successful career in real estate. &nbsp;From 1994 to 2000, he was 
secretary and director of Marsadi Layne Properties Inc., a large real estate 
property manager and developer in Southern Ontario. &nbsp;From 1996 to 2015, Mr.
Brooks has been president of Rentcom Plus Inc., a privately owned real estate 
based corporation. &nbsp;Mr. Brooks has also been involved in corporate business
including property management, finance and real estate redevelopment. &nbsp;He 
is a Member Broker and Broker of Record for the Real Estate Council of 
Ontario.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">Richard Kaiser, 
our corporate secretary and corporate governance officer since March 24, 2015, 
has served as Co-owner of Yes International since July 1991, a full service 
investor relations and venture capital firm. &nbsp;He has a Bachelor of Arts 
degree in International Economics from Oakland University (formerly known as 
Michigan State University-Honors College).</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman 
Bold"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman Bold"><B>Executive Officers</B></FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">The following individuals serve as Bravo&#146;s executive
officers as of August 1, 2016:</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="font-size:10pt" cellspacing=0 align=center><TR><TD 
width=97.2></TD><TD width=54></TD><TD width=213.65></TD></TR>

<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">The members of 
our board of directors are subject to change from time to time by the vote of 
the stockholders at special or annual meetings to elect directors. &nbsp;Our 
current board of directors consists of three directors, who have expertise in 
the business of Bravo Multinational.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">The foregoing 
notwithstanding, except as otherwise provided in any resolution or resolutions 
of the board, directors who are elected at an annual meeting of stockholders, 
and directors elected in the interim to fill vacancies and newly created 
directorships, will hold office for the term for which elected and until their 
successors are elected and qualified or until their earlier death, resignation 
or removal.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">Whenever the 
holders of any class or classes of stock or any series thereof are entitled to 
elect one or more directors pursuant to any resolution or resolutions of the 
board, vacancies and newly created directorships of such class or classes or 
series thereof may generally be filled by a majority of the directors elected by
such class or classes or series then in office, by a sole remaining director so 
elected or by the unanimous written consent or the affirmative vote of a 
majority of the outstanding shares of such class or classes or series entitled 
to elect such director or directors. &nbsp;Officers are elected annually by the 
directors. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0pt; font-size:12pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt" align=center>7</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; page-break-before:always"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">We may employ 
additional management personnel, as our board of directors deems necessary. 
&nbsp;Bravo Multinational has not identified or reached an agreement or 
understanding with any other individuals to serve in management positions, but 
does not anticipate any problem in employing qualified staff.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">Martin Wolfe is 
a BA, CA (Chartered Accountant) and CPA (Chartered Professional Accountant) who 
received his designation in 1980. &nbsp;Mr. Wolfe has served on the board of 
Bravo Multinational Incorporated since June 2, 2014, and is currently our chief 
financial officer. &nbsp;Mr. Wolfe has over 35 years of experience in both 
public practice and in industry. &nbsp;Currently, Mr. Wolfe, in addition to 
operating as a sole practitioner, provides consulting services to the insolvency
and restructuring industry. &nbsp;Mr. Wolfe has declined to be reelected to our 
board of directors.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">A description of
the business experience for Messrs. Parliament, Brooks, and Kaiser is set forth 
above.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">On November 9, 
2015, we added Allen Simon, as a Senior Advisor to the Executive Committee of 
Bravo Multinational Incorporated. &nbsp;Mr. Simon has no voting privileges with 
respect to his position.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman 
Bold"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman Bold"><B>Committees of the 
Board</B></FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">We currently have an Executive Committee of our board of 
directors which was established on March 24, 2015. &nbsp;However, we do not
currently have an Audit, Executive, Finance, Compensation, or Nominating 
Committee, or any other committee of the board of directors. &nbsp;We have 
adopted a charter for the Executive Committee as well as charters for the other 
committees, in the event that we elect to implement them. &nbsp;Copies of the 
charters for each committee have been previously filed with the Securities and 
Exchange Commission. &nbsp;In addition, we have posted copies of the charters 
for each committee on our website at www.bravomultinational.com. &nbsp;We will 
provide to any person without charge, upon request, a copy of the charter for 
any of our committees. &nbsp;In addition, we intend to post on our website all 
disclosures that are required by law concerning any amendments to our 
committees. &nbsp;Any such request should be directed to Mr. Richard Kaiser, our
corporate secretary, at 3419 Virginia Beach Boulevard, Unit 252, Virginia Beach,
Virginia 23452, telephone (757) 306-6090, or email him at 
info@bravomultinational.com. &nbsp;The information contained in our website 
shall not constitute part of these Proxy Materials.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">The 
responsibilities of these committees are fulfilled by our board of directors and
all of our directors participate in such responsibilities, none of whom is 
&#147;independent&#148; as defined under Rule 4200(a)(15) of the NASD&#146;s 
listing standards described below, as our financial constraints have made it 
extremely difficult to attract and retain qualified independent board members. 
&nbsp;Since we do not have any of the subject committees, other than our 
Executive Committee, our entire board of directors participates in all of the 
considerations with respect to our audit, finance, compensation, and nomination 
deliberations.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">Rule 4200(a)(15)
of the NASD&#146;s listing standards defines an &#147;independent director&#148;
as a person other than an executive officer or employee of the company or any 
other individual having a relationship which, in the opinion of the 
issuer&#146;s board of directors, would interfere with the exercise of 
independent judgment in carrying out the responsibilities of a director. 
&nbsp;The following persons shall not be considered independent:</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:72pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">A director who is, or at any time during the past three 
years was, employed by the company;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:72pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">A director who accepted or who has a Family Member who 
accepted any compensation from the company in excess of $120,000 during any 
period of twelve consecutive months within the three years preceding the 
determination of independence, other than the following: (i) compensation for 
board or board committee service; (ii) compensation paid to a Family Member who 
is an employee (other than as an executive officer) of the company; or (iii) 
benefits under a tax-qualified retirement plan, or non-discretionary 
compensation. &nbsp;Provided, however, that in addition to the requirements 
contained in this paragraph, audit committee members are also subject to 
additional, more stringent requirements under Rule 4350(d).</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0pt; font-size:12pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt" align=center>8</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; page-break-before:always"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:72pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">A director who is a Family Member of an individual who 
is, or at any time during the past three years was, employed by the company as 
an executive officer;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:72pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">A director who is, or has a Family Member who is, a 
partner in, or a controlling stockholder or an executive officer of, any 
organization to which the company made, or from which the company received, 
payments for property or services in the current or any of the past three fiscal
years that exceed five percent of the recipient&#146;s consolidated gross 
revenues for that year, or $200,000, whichever is more, other than the 
following: (i) payments arising solely from investments in the company&#146;s 
securities; or (ii) payments under non-discretionary charitable contribution 
matching programs;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:72pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">A director of the issuer who is, or has a Family Member 
who is, employed as an executive officer of another entity where at any time 
during the past three years any of the executive officers of the issuer serve on
the compensation committee of such other entity; or</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:72pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">A director who is, or has a Family Member who is, a 
current partner of the company&#146;s outside auditor, or was a partner or 
employee of Bravo&#146;s outside auditor who worked on the company&#146;s audit 
at any time during any of the past three years.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">We hope to add 
qualified independent members of our board of directors at a later date, 
depending upon our ability to reach and maintain financial stability.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman 
Bold"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman Bold"><B>Executive Committee</B></FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">In accordance with Article III of our bylaws, our board 
of directors has established an Executive Committee which consists of members 
who have been appointed by the board of directors. &nbsp;The initial chairman of
the Executive Committee is Paul Parliament. &nbsp;Thereafter, the chairman of 
the Executive Committee shall be appointed by the members of the Executive 
Committee. &nbsp;The remaining two members of the Executive Committee are Martin
Wolfe, and Douglas Brooks. &nbsp;The members of the Executive Committee shall 
serve at the pleasure of the board of directors or until their successors shall 
be duly designated. &nbsp;Vacancies in the Executive Committee shall be filled 
by the board of directors.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">During the 
intervals between the meetings of the board of directors, the Executive 
Committee shall have and may exercise all of the authority of the board of 
directors in the management of the business affairs of Bravo to the extent 
authorized by the resolution providing for the Executive Committee or by 
subsequent resolution adopted by a majority of the whole board of directors. 
&nbsp;This authorization is subject to the limitations imposed by law, the 
bylaws of Bravo Multinational Incorporated or the board of directors.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">During the 
fiscal year ended December 31, 2015, the Executive Committee held two formal 
meetings and no meetings where committee actions were taken by written consent. 
&nbsp;</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman 
Bold"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman Bold"><B>Audit Committee</B></FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">The entire board of directors performs the functions of 
an audit committee, but no written charter governs the actions of the board when
performing the functions of what would generally be performed by an audit 
committee. &nbsp;The board approves the selection of our independent accountants
and meets and interacts with the independent accountants to discuss issues 
related to financial reporting. &nbsp;In addition, the board reviews the scope 
and results of the audit with the independent accountants, reviews with 
management and the independent accountants our annual operating results, 
considers the adequacy of our internal accounting procedures and considers other
auditing and accounting matters including fees to be paid to the independent 
auditor and the performance of the independent auditor. &nbsp;At the present 
time, Paul Parliament, our chief executive officer and Martin Wolfe, our chief 
financial officer, are considered to be our experts in financial and accounting 
matters.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt"><BR>
<P style="margin:0pt" align=center>9</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman 
Bold"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman Bold"><B>Nominating Committee</B></FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">Our size and the size of our board, at this time, do not 
require a separate nominating committee. &nbsp;When evaluating director 
nominees, our directors consider the following factors:</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:72pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">The appropriate size of our board of 
directors;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:72pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">Our needs with respect to the particular talents and 
experience of our directors;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:72pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">The knowledge, skills and experience of nominees, 
including experience in finance, administration or public service, in light of 
prevailing business conditions and the knowledge, skills and experience already 
possessed by other members of the board;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:72pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">Experience in political affairs;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:72pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">Experience with accounting rules and practices; 
and</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:72pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">The desire to balance the benefit of continuity with the 
periodic injection of the fresh perspective provided by new board 
members.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">Our goal is to 
assemble a board that brings together a variety of perspectives and skills 
derived from high quality business and professional experience. &nbsp;In doing 
so, the board will also consider candidates with appropriate non-business 
backgrounds.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">Other than the 
foregoing, there are no stated minimum criteria for director nominees, although 
the board may also consider such other factors as it may deem are in our best 
interests as well as our stockholders. &nbsp;In addition, the board identifies 
nominees by first evaluating the current members of the board willing to 
continue in service. &nbsp;Current members of the board with skills and 
experience that are relevant to our business and who are willing to continue in 
service are considered for re-nomination. &nbsp;If any member of the board does 
not wish to continue in service or if the board decides not to re-nominate a 
member for re-election, the board then identifies the desired skills and
experience of a new nominee in light of the criteria above. &nbsp;Current 
members of the board are polled for suggestions as to individuals meeting the 
criteria described above. &nbsp;The board may also engage in research to 
identify qualified individuals. &nbsp;To date, we have not engaged third parties
to identify or evaluate or assist in identifying potential nominees, although we
reserve the right in the future to retain a third party search firm, if 
necessary. &nbsp;The board does not typically consider stockholder nominees 
because it believes that its current nomination process is sufficient to 
identify directors who serve our best interests.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="line-height:14pt; margin:0pt; font-size:12pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt" align=center>10</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; page-break-before:always"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt"><b>Finance Committee</b></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">Although we 
currently do not have a Finance Committee, we have adopted a charter which 
provides that when established it will oversee all areas of corporate finance 
for Bravo and its subsidiaries, including capital structure, equity and debt 
financings, capital expenditures, cash management, banking activities and 
relationships, investments, foreign exchange activities and share repurchase 
activities. &nbsp;The Finance Committee will consist of a minimum of three 
members of the board of directors, the majority of whom shall meet the same 
independence and experience requirements of the Audit Committee of Bravo and the
applicable provisions of federal law and the rules and regulations promulgated 
thereunder and the applicable rules of The Nasdaq Stock Market, the New York 
Stock Exchange, or any other exchange where the shares of Bravo may be listed or
quoted for sale. &nbsp;The members of the Finance Committee are to be 
recommended by the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee and are 
appointed by and serve at the discretion of the board of directors.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt"><B>Compensation Committee</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">Although we 
currently do not have a Compensation Committee, we have adopted a charter which 
provides that when established it is to assist the board of directors in meeting
its responsibilities with regard to oversight and determination of executive 
compensation and to review and make recommendations to the board of directors 
with respect to major compensation plans, policies and programs of Bravo. 
&nbsp;The Compensation Committee shall consist of not fewer than two members of 
the board of directors, with the exact number being determined by the board. 
&nbsp;Members of the Compensation Committee shall be appointed from time to time
to serve in such capacity by the Board. &nbsp;Each member shall meet the 
independence and outside director requirements of applicable tax and securities 
laws and regulations and stock market rules.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:8.35pt"><B>Conflicts of Interest</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:8.35pt; text-indent:36pt">With respect 
to transactions involving real or apparent conflicts of interest, we have 
adopted written policies and procedures, which are contained in our Corporate 
Governance Principles, and which require that:</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:72pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">The fact of the relationship or interest giving rise to 
the potential conflict be disclosed or known to the directors who authorize or 
approve the transaction prior to such authorization or approval;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:72pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">The transaction be approved by a majority of our 
disinterested outside directors; and</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:72pt"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman">The transaction be fair and reasonable to us at the time 
it is authorized or approved by our directors.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt"><B>Code of Ethics for Senior 
Executive Officers and Senior Financial Officers</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">We have adopted 
an amended Code of Ethics for Senior Executive Officers and Senior Financial 
Officers that applies to our president, chief executive officer, chief operating
officer, chief financial officer, and all financial officers, including the 
principal accounting officer. &nbsp;The code provides as follows:</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:72pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">Each officer is responsible for full, fair, accurate, 
timely and understandable disclosure in all periodic reports and financial 
disclosures required to be filed by us with the Securities and Exchange 
Commission or disclosed to our stockholders and/or the public.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:72pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">Each officer shall immediately bring to the attention of 
the audit committee, or disclosure compliance officer, any material information 
of which the officer becomes aware that affects the disclosures made by us in 
our public filings and assist the audit committee or disclosure compliance 
officer in fulfilling its responsibilities for full, fair, accurate, timely and 
understandable disclosure in all periodic reports required to be filed with the 
Securities and Exchange Commission.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:72pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">Each officer shall promptly notify our general counsel, 
if any, or the president or chief executive officer as well as the audit 
committee of any information he may have concerning any violation of our Code of
Business Conduct or our Code of Ethics, including any actual or apparent 
conflicts of interest between personal and professional relationships, involving
any management or other employees who have a significant role in our financial 
reporting, disclosures or internal controls.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt"><BR>
<P style="margin:0pt" align=center>11</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:72pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">Each officer shall immediately bring to the attention of 
our general counsel, if any, the president or the chief executive officer and 
the audit committee any information he may have concerning evidence of a 
material violation of the securities or other laws, rules or regulations 
applicable to us and the operation of our business, by us or any of our 
agents.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:72pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">Any waiver of this Code of Ethics for any officer must be
approved, if at all, in advance by a majority of the independent directors 
serving on our board of directors. &nbsp;Any such waivers granted will be 
publicly disclosed in accordance with applicable rules, regulations and listing 
standards.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman 
Bold"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman Bold"><B>Code of Business 
Conduct</B></FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman">We have adopted a Code of Business Conduct, which applies
to Bravo and all of our subsidiaries, whereby we expect each employee to use 
sound judgment to help us maintain appropriate compliance procedures and to 
carry out our business in compliance with laws and high ethical standards. 
&nbsp;Each of our employees is expected to read our Code of Business Conduct and
demonstrate personal commitment to the standards set forth in our Code of 
Business Conduct. &nbsp;Our officers and other supervising employees are 
expected to be leaders in demonstrating this personal commitment to the 
standards outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and recognizing indications 
of illegal or improper conduct. &nbsp;All employees are expected to report 
appropriately any indications of illegal or improper conduct. &nbsp;An employee 
who does not comply with the standards set forth in our Code of Business Conduct
may be subject to discipline in light of the nature of the violation, including 
termination of employment.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">Copies of our 
Corporate Governance Principles, our amended Code of Ethics for Senior Executive
Officers and Senior Financial Officers, and our Code of Business Conduct have 
been previously filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission. &nbsp;In 
addition, we have posted copies of our Corporate Governance Principles, our 
amended Code of Ethics for Senior Executive Officers and Senior Financial 
Officers, and our Code of Business Conduct on our website at 
www.bravomultinational.com. &nbsp;We will provide to any person without charge, 
upon request, a copy of our Corporate Governance Principles, our amended Code of
Ethics for Senior Executive Officers and Senior Financial Officers, and our Code
of Business Conduct. &nbsp;In addition, we intend to post on our website all 
disclosures that are required by law concerning any amendments to our Corporate 
Governance Principles, our amended Code of Ethics for Senior Executive Officers 
and Senior Financial Officers, and our Code of Business Conduct. &nbsp;Any such 
request should be directed to Mr. Richard Kaiser, our corporate secretary, at 
3419 Virginia Beach Boulevard, Unit 252, Virginia Beach, Virginia 23452, 
telephone (757) 306-6090, or email him at info@bravomultinational.com. &nbsp;The
information contained in our website shall not constitute part of these Proxy 
Materials.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt"><B>Board of Directors 
Meetings</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">During the year 
ended December 31, 2015, our board of directors held four formal meetings and
 no meetings where board actions were taken by written consent.&nbsp;All of 
Bravo&#146;s directors attended at least 100% of the aggregate number of the 
meetings of our board of directors while they were members of our board.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">Bravo has 
encouraged all incumbent directors and the nominee for election as a director to
attend the 2016 Annual Meeting.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:8.35pt"><BR>
<P style="margin:0pt" align=center>12</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; page-break-before:always"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:8.35pt"><b>Communication with 
Directors</b></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:8.35pt; text-indent:36pt">Stockholders 
and other interested parties may contact any of our directors by writing to them
at Bravo Multinational Incorporated, 3419 Virginia Beach Boulevard, Unit 252, 
Virginia Beach, Virginia 23452, Attention: Corporate Secretary, telephone (716) 
803-0621, or email at info@bravomultinational.com.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">Our board has 
approved a process for handling letters received by us and addressed to any of 
our directors. &nbsp;Under that process, our vice president reviews all such 
correspondence and regularly forwards to the directors a summary of all such 
correspondence, together with copies of all such correspondence that, in the 
opinion of our vice president, deal with functions of the board or committees 
thereof or that he otherwise determines requires their attention. 
&nbsp;Directors may at any time review a log of all correspondence received by
us that are addressed to members of the board and request copies of such 
correspondence.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman 
Bold"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman Bold"><B>Director Compensation</B></FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">As a result of the election of Mr. Brooks as a director 
of Bravo, Mr. Brooks was awarded 2,000,000 shares of our restricted common 
stock. &nbsp;Moreover, due to his election as a director, Mr. Brooks made a 
$100,000 direct investment in Bravo on October 1, 2015, in exchange for a 
convertible promissory note, providing for conversion rights into shares of our 
common stock based on Bravo&#146;s common stock price low as of September 23, 
2015, which was $0.0212 per share. &nbsp;You may obtain a copy of the 
convertible promissory note executed by Bravo  at www.sec.gov or by clicking on 
the Securities and Exchange Commission Filings link on the Investor Relations 
section of our website at www.bravomultinational.com, or by contacting Mr. 
Richard Kaiser, our corporate secretary, at 3419 Virginia Beach Boulevard, Unit 
252, Virginia Beach, Virginia 23452, telephone (716) 803-0621, or email him at 
info@bravomultinational.com.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">At the meeting 
of the board of directors of Bravo Multinational Incorporated held on September 
25, 2015, the board of directors voted that any new director elected to the 
board of directors of Bravo shall receive $25,000 per year in shares of our 
common stock registered pursuant to a registration statement on Form S-8 filed 
with the Securities and Exchange Commission to be paid quarterly. &nbsp;In 
addition, any new director shall be required to make a direct investment of not 
less than $100,000 into Bravo in exchange for a convertible promissory note to 
be submitted to the board of directors for approval.</P>
