<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt" align=center><B>RATIFICATION OF 
THE AMENDMENT AND RESTATEMENT OF OUR BYLAWS<BR>
(PROPOSAL 2)</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">On September 25,
2015, at a Special Meeting of our stockholders, our stockholders approved our
amended and restated bylaws, inasmuch as Bravo cannot attract seven directors, 
without directors&#146; insurance. &nbsp;We also changed the provisions in our 
bylaws to simply the nomination process for our directors. &nbsp;Previously, on 
March 24, 2015, our directors approved our amended and restated bylaws to 
replace the unsuitable and inconsistent provisions with more appropriate 
provisions. &nbsp;A summary of our amended and restated bylaws approved on March
24, 2015, and September 25, 2015, is set forth below. &nbsp;This summary is, 
however, qualified in its entirety by and subject to the more complete 
information set forth in our amended and restated bylaws approved on </P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt"><BR>
<P style="margin:0pt" align=center>13</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; page-break-before:always"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt">September 25, 2015, a copy of 
which is attached hereto as <u>Annex B</u><i>.</i> &nbsp;You may obtain a copy 
of our amended and restated bylaws approved on September 25, 2015, as well as 
our bylaws in effect before March 24, 2015, a copy of which is attached hereto 
as <U>Annex D </U>, and our amended and restated bylaws adopted on March 24, 
2015, a copy of which is attached hereto as <U>Annex C </U>, by accessing this 
Proxy Statement as filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on the 
Internet at www.sec.gov or by clicking on the Securities and Exchange Commission
Filings link on the Investor Relations section of our website at 
www.bravomultinational.com, or by contacting Mr. Richard Kaiser, our corporate 
secretary, at 3419 Virginia Beach Boulevard, Unit 252, Virginia Beach, Virginia 
23452, telephone (757) 306-6090, or email him at 
info@bravomultinational.com.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">On March 24, 
2015, we specifically modified or eliminated provisions contained in Paragraphs 
2.13, 3.12, 3.13, and 5.4 of our bylaws in effect before March 24, 2015. 
&nbsp;We also modified other provisions using more up-to date language.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">Among others, we
changed:</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:72pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">Paragraph 2.13 to eliminate inconsistent 
language;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:72pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">Paragraph 3.12 to eliminate the provision that directors 
could only be removed by our stockholders for cause;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:72pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">Paragraph 3.13 to provide that our chairman of the board 
is an officer; and</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:72pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">Paragraph 5.4 to eliminate the provision that any officer
chosen by our board of directors could only be removed by our board of 
directors.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">On September 25,
2015, we specifically modified or eliminated provisions contained in Paragraphs 
2.3. 2.4, 2.5, 2.8, and 3.2 of our bylaws in effect before September 25, 2015. 
&nbsp;Paragraphs 2.3. 2.4, 2.5, and 2.8 dealt with the stockholder matters, 
while Paragraph 3.2 changed the language providing in the absence of a 
resolution by our board of directors in establishing the size of our board of 
directors, the number of our directors shall be three.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">We are asking 
our stockholders to ratify their vote taken on September 25, 2015, to amend and
restate our bylaws.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt" align=justify><B>Vote 
Required</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">The affirmative 
vote of a majority of the total number of shares of our common stock including 
the voting rights of the Series A preferred stock present in person or 
represented by proxy at the 2016 Annual Meeting is required to approve the 
ratification of our amended and restated bylaws on September 25, 2015. &nbsp;The
controlling stockholders will have the power to vote 683,936,299 shares of our 
common stock, which number exceeds the majority of the 371,300,924 issued and 
outstanding shares of the common stock on the Record Date. &nbsp;The controlling
stockholders will vote to ratify the vote taken on September 25, 2015, to amend 
and restate our bylaws.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">The board of 
directors has unanimously approved the ratification of our amended and restated 
bylaws on September 25, 2015, and recommends that the stockholders vote 
&#147;FOR&#148; the ratification.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt" align=center><B>RATIFICATION OF 
THE AMENDMENT AND RESTATEMENT OF OUR CERTIFICATE OF INCORPORATION<BR>
(PROPOSAL 3)</B></P>
<P style="line-height:normal; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-
indent:36pt">On September 25, 2015, at a Special Meetingof our stockholders, our
stockholders approved our amended and restated certificate of incorporation, 
inasmuch as the provisions in our then existing certificate of incorporation 
contained provisions which were not appropriate for a company who shares are 
traded in the public market, and replaced the unsuitable provisions with more 
appropriate provisions. &nbsp;The amended and restated certificate of 
incorporation was filed with the Secretary of State of Delaware on September 25,
2015. &nbsp;Our board of directors, voted to submit to our stockholders the 
amended and restated certificate of incorporation for ratification at the 2016 
Annual Meeting.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt"><BR>
<P style="margin:0pt" align=center>14</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; page-break-before:always"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">A summary of our
amended and restated certificate of incorporation approved on September 25, 
2015, and filed with the Secretary of State of Delaware on September 25, 2015, 
is set forth below. &nbsp;This summary is, however, qualified in its entirety by
and subject to the more complete information set forth in our amended and 
restated certificate of incorporation, a copy of which is attached hereto as 
<U>Annex E</U><I>.</I> &nbsp;You may obtain a copy of our amended and restated 
certificate of incorporation approved on September 25, 2015, as well as our 
certificate of incorporation in effect before September 25, 2015, a copy of 
which is attached hereto as <U>Annex F</U>, by accessing this Proxy Statement as
filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on the Internet at www.sec.gov
or by clicking on the Securities and Exchange Commission Filings link on the 
Investor Relations section of our website at www.bravomultinational.com, or by 
contacting Mr. Richard Kaiser, our corporate secretary, at 3419 Virginia Beach 
Boulevard, Unit 252, Virginia Beach, Virginia 23452, telephone (716) 803-0621, 
or email him at info@bravomultinational.com.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">On September 25,
2015, we specifically modified or eliminated provisions contained in our 
certificate of incorporation in effect before September 25, 2015.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">Among others, we
changed or eliminated:</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:72pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">Article Eleven provided that directors could only be 
removed for cause and only by the affirmative vote of the holders of at least 
80% of the outstanding shares of our common stock. &nbsp;This provision was 
eliminated.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:72pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">Article Fourteen prohibited actions by consent of the 
stockholders. &nbsp;This provision was eliminated.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt" align=justify>On
September 25, 2015, there was no change in the capital structure of Bravo 
Multinational Incorporated.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman Bold" 
align=justify><FONT FACE="Times New Roman Bold"><B>Vote Required</B></FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt" 
align=justify>The affirmative vote of a majority of the total number of shares 
of our common stock including the voting rights of the Series A preferred stock 
present in person or represented by proxy at the 2016 Annual Meeting is required
to approve the ratification of our amended and restated certificate of 
incorporation on September 25, 2015. &nbsp;The controlling stockholders will 
have the power to vote 683,936,299 shares of our common stock, which number 
exceeds the majority of the 371,300,924 issued and outstanding shares of the 
common stock on the Record Date. &nbsp;The controlling stockholders will vote to
ratify the vote taken on September 25, 2015, to amend and restate our 
certificate of incorporation. </P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt" 
align=justify>The board of directors has unanimously approved the ratification 
of our amended and restated certificate of incorporation on September 25, 2015, 
and recommends that the stockholders vote &#147;FOR&#148; the ratification.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt" align=center><B>ADOPTION OF 
EMPLOYEES, OFFICERS, DIRECTORS, AND CONSULTANTS STOCK PLAN FOR THE YEAR 2016<BR>
(PROPOSAL 4)</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">On March 18, 
2016, the board of directors adopted the Employees, Officers, Directors, and 
Consultants Stock Plan for the Year 2016 (the "2016 Plan"), subject to approval 
by the stockholders at the 2016 Annual Meeting.  Likewise, on March 18, 2016, 
Bravo filed with the SEC a Form S-8 registration statement to register the 
issuance of the shares to be issued pursuant to the 2016 Plan.  The Form S-8 
registration statement was amended on March 21, 2016, to include the 
indemnification provisions contained in our bylaws that were inadvertently 
omitted from the Form S-8 registration statement filed on March 18, 2016.  </P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt"> </P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt"><BR>
<P style="margin:0pt" align=center>15</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; page-break-before:always"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">As of the Record
Date, 24,182,478 shares of our common stock had been issued under the 2016 Plan.
&nbsp;A summary of the 2016 Plan is set forth below. &nbsp;This summary is, 
however, qualified in its entirety by and subject to the more complete 
information set forth in the 2016 Plan, a copy of which is attached hereto as 
<U>Annex G</U><I>.</I> &nbsp;You may obtain a copy of the 2016 Plan by accessing
this Proxy Statement as filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on the
Internet at www.sec.gov or by clicking on the Securities and Exchange Commission
Filings link on the Investor Relations section of our website at 
www.bravomultinational.com, or by contacting Mr. Richard Kaiser, our corporate 
secretary, at 3419 Virginia Beach Boulevard, Unit 252, Virginia Beach, Virginia 
23452, telephone (716) 803-0621, or email him at 
info@bravomultinational.com.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt"><I>Purposes</I>.
&nbsp;The purpose of the 2016 Plan is to promote the interests of Bravo and its 
stockholders by attracting and retaining Employees, Directors, and Consultants 
capable of furthering the future success of Bravo and by aligning their economic
interests more closely with those of Bravo's stockholders.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt"><I>Shares 
Subject to the 2016 Plan. &nbsp;</I>The maximum number of shares of our common
stock that may be issued under the 2016 Plan is 50,000,000, subject to 
adjustment in the event of a change in the capitalization or a change in control
of Bravo.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt"><I>Term of</I> 
<I>the 2016 Plan</I>. &nbsp;The 2016 Plan was adopted by our board of directors 
effective March 18, 2016, provided that the stockholders of Bravo must approve 
the 2016 Plan within 12 months before or after such effective date. &nbsp;Unless
the 2016 Plan is earlier terminated in accordance with its provisions, the 2016 
Plan shall expire on March 18, 2026.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-
indent:36pt"><I>Administration of the 2016 Plan</I>. &nbsp;The 2016 Plan is 
administered by the compensation committee with full and complete authority to 
administer the 2016 Plan in all aspects. &nbsp;All interpretations and 
constructions of the 2016 Plan by the compensation committee, and all of its 
actions hereunder, shall be binding and conclusive on all persons for all 
purposes.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt"><I>Eligible 
Recipient</I>. &nbsp;Each individual who is an Employee, Director, or Consultant
on the Effective Date and each individual who becomes an Employee, Director, or 
Consultant thereafter during the term of the 2016 Plan shall be a participant 
(the "Participant") in the 2016 Plan, in each case during such period as such 
individual remains an Employee, Director, or Consultant of the Company or any of
its subsidiaries.  Each credit of shares of Bravo stock pursuant to the 2016 
Plan shall be evidenced by a written agreement duly executed and delivered by or
on behalf of Bravo and a Participant, if such an agreement is required by Bravo 
to assure compliance with all applicable laws and regulations.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt"><I>Grant of 
Shares</I>. &nbsp;Commencing on the Effective Date, the amount of compensation 
or bonus for service to the Participants shall be payable in shares of the Bravo
common stock (the "Stock Award") pursuant to the 2016 Plan.  The deemed issuance
price of shares of our common stock subject to each Stock Award shall not be 
less than 85 percent of the Fair Market Value of the common stock on the date of
the grant.  In the case of any person who owns securities possessing more than 
ten percent of the combined voting power of all classes of securities of the 
issuer or its parent or subsidiaries possessing voting power, the deemed 
issuance price of shares of the common stock subject to each Stock Award shall 
be at least 100 percent of the Fair Market Value of the common stock on the date
of the grant.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt"><I>Stockholder 
Rights</I>. &nbsp;The certificates for shares delivered to a Participant 
pursuant to the Stock Award shall be issued in the name of the Participant, and 
from and after the date of such issuance the Participant shall be entitled to 
all rights of a stockholder with respect to all such shares issued in his name, 
including the right to vote the shares, and the Participant shall receive all 
dividends and other distributions paid or made with respect thereto.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt"><I>Amendment and
Termination</I>. &nbsp;The board of directors may from time to time make such 
amendments to the 2016 Plan, as it may deem proper and in the best interest of 
Bravo without further approval of Bravo&#146;s stockholders, except to the 
extent required under Delaware law or to qualify transactions under the 2016 
Plan for exemption under Rule 16b-3 promulgated under the Exchange Act. 
&nbsp;Pursuant to the 2016 Plan, the board of directors may terminate the 2016 
Plan at any time by a vote of a majority of the members thereof.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt"><BR>
<P style="margin:0pt" align=center>16</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; page-break-before:always"><BR></P>

<P style="line-height:10pt; margin:0pt; font-family:Dutch801 Rm BT; font-
size:8pt"><FONT FACE="Dutch801 Rm BT">__________</FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-10pt; font-
size:8pt"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman">(1)</FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:8pt; text-indent:18pt;
font-size:8pt">Based on the fair market value of our common stock as of August 
1, 2016, per share ($0.017) as reported on the OTCQB.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">The compensation committee will not increase the number 
of shares available for issuance under the 2016 Plan.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman 
Bold"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman Bold"><B>Federal Income Tax 
Consequences</B></FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">The following is a brief description of the material 
United States federal income tax consequences under the 2016 Plan. &nbsp;It is 
based on existing United Sates laws and regulations, and there can be no 
assurance that those laws and regulations will not change in the future. 
&nbsp;The summary does not purport to be complete and does not discuss the tax 
consequences upon a participant&#146;s death, or the provisions of the income 
tax laws of any municipality, state or foreign country in which the participant 
may reside, or all possible tax consequences of the receipt or exercise of stock
rights under the 2016 Plan, which consequences may vary depending upon a 
participant&#146;s individual tax and financial circumstances.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt"><I>Direct Stock 
Issuance</I>. &nbsp;With respect to the receipt of a stock award not subject to 
any restrictions under the 2016 Plan, the participant would have ordinary 
income, at the time of receipt, in an amount equal to the difference between the
fair market value of the stock received at such time and the amount, if any, 
paid by the holder for the stock award.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt"><I>Limitation on
Tax Deductions for Bravo</I>. &nbsp;Notwithstanding the preceding provisions, no
federal income tax deduction is allowed for compensation paid to a &#147;covered
employee&#148; in any taxable year of Bravo to the extent that such compensation
exceeds $1,000,000. &nbsp;The $1,000,000 limitation is reduced (but not below 
zero) by the amount (if any) that would have been included in the compensation 
of a covered employee for a taxable year but for being disallowed by reason of 
being a golden parachute payment under Internal Revenue Code &#167;280G. 
&nbsp;For this purpose, &#147;covered employees&#148; are generally the chief 
executive officer of Bravo and the four highest compensated officers of Bravo, 
and the term &#147;compensation&#148; generally includes amounts includable in 
gross income as a result of the exercise of stock options or stock appreciation 
rights, or the receipt of restricted stock. &nbsp;This deduction limitation does
not apply to compensation that is commission based compensation, performance 
based compensation or compensation that would not be includable in an 
employee&#146;s gross income.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt"><I>ERISA.</I> 
&nbsp;The 2006 Plan is not, and is not intended to be, an employee benefit plans
subject to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as amended, as 
it does not provide either welfare benefits or a deferral of income for periods 
extending to the termination of employment or retirement.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt"><BR>
<P style="margin:0pt" align=center>17</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; page-break-before:always"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman 
Bold"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman Bold"><b>Vote Required for 
Approval</b></FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">The affirmative vote of a majority of the votes entitled 
to be cast at the 2016 Annual Meeting is required to approve the 2016 
Plan.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">The affirmative 
vote of a majority of the total number of shares of our common stock including 
the voting rights of the Series A preferred stock present in person or 
represented by proxy at the 2016 Annual Meeting is required to approve the 2016 
Plan. &nbsp;The controlling stockholders will have the power to vote 683,936,299
shares of our common stock, which number exceeds the majority of the 371,300,924
issued and outstanding shares of the common stock on the Record Date. &nbsp;The 
controlling stockholders will vote to approve the 2016 Plan.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">The board of 
directors has unanimously approved the 2016 Plan and recommends that the 
stockholders vote &#147;FOR&#148; the 2016 Plan.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt" align=center><B>RATIFICATION OF 
THE APPOINTMENT OF<BR>
INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM<BR>
(PROPOSAL 5)</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">Subject to 
ratification by our stockholders, our board of directors has appointed Scrudato 
&amp; Co. CPA to serve as our independent public accounting firm for the fiscal 
year ended December 31, 2015. &nbsp;The appointment of Scrudato &amp; Co. CPA 
was recommended to our board by our board of directors acting as an audit 
committee. &nbsp;Scrudato &amp; Co. CPA have served as our independent public 
accounting firm since November 9, 2015. &nbsp;Representatives of Scrudato &amp; 
Co. CPA are not expected to be present at the 2016 Annual Meeting.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman 
Bold"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman Bold"><B>Audit Fees</B></FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">The aggregate fees billed by Scrudato &amp; Co. CPA for 
professional services rendered for the audit of our annual financial statements 
for the fiscal years ended December 31, 2015, were $14,000 and December 31, 
2014, were $14,000.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman 
Bold"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman Bold"><B>Audit-Related Fees</B></FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">The aggregate audit-related fees billed by Scrudato &amp;
Co. CPA for professional services rendered for the audit of our annual financial
statements for the fiscal years ended December 31, 2015, were $14,000 and 
December 31, 2014, were $14,000.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman 
Bold"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman Bold"><B>Tax Fees</B></FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">The aggregate tax fees billed by Scrudato &amp; Co. CPA 
for professional services rendered for tax services for the fiscal years ended 
December 31, 2015, and December 31, 2014, were NIL.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman 
Bold"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman Bold"><B>All Other Fees</B></FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">There were no other fees billed by Scrudato &amp; Co. CPA
for professional services rendered during the fiscal years ended December 31, 
2015, and December 31, 2014, other than as stated under the captions Audit Fees,
Audit-Related Fees, and Tax Fees.</FONT></P>
<br>
<P style="margin:0pt" align=center>18</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; page-break-before:always"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman 
Bold"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman Bold"><B>Audit Committee Pre-Approval Policies
and Procedures</B></FONT>
</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">The board of
directors acting as an audit committee has adopted a policy requiring pre-
approval by the committee of all services (audit and non-audit) to be provided 
by its independent auditor. &nbsp;All fiscal 2015 and 2014 services were pre-
approved by the audit committee. &nbsp;The audit committee considers the 
provision of non-audit services to be compatible with maintaining the 
independence of Scrudato &amp; Co. CPA.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman 
Bold"><b>Changes in Our Certifying Accountant</b></FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">During the last two fiscal years, we have had no 
disagreements with our accountants on accounting and financial 
disclosure.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">However, on 
November 4, 2015, we were notified by our independent certifying accountant, 
W.T. Uniack &amp; Co. CPAs, P.C. (&#147;Uniack&#148;) that Uniack was resigning 
as our independent auditor.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">Uniack&#146;s 
reports on Bravo Multinational Incorporated&#146;s financial statements for the 
years ended December 31, 2014, and December 31, 2013, did not contain an adverse
opinion or a disclaimer of opinion, and were not qualified or modified as to 
uncertainty, audit scope, or accounting principles. &nbsp;Uniack did not prepare
a report for 2014 or perform any review of our financial statements for 
2015.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">The decision to 
accept the resignation of Uniack was made by our board of directors.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">During the two 
most recent fiscal years and any subsequent interim period through November 4, 
2015, there have not been any disagreements between Bravo Multinational 
Incorporated and Uniack on any matter of accounting principles or practices, 
financial statement disclosure, or auditing scope or procedure, which 
disagreements, if not resolved to the satisfaction of Uniack, would have caused 
it to make reference to the subject matter of the disagreements in connection 
with its reports on the financial statements for such periods.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">On November 9, 
2015, Bravo Multinational Incorporated engaged Scrudato &amp; Co. CPA as our 
independent accountants to report on our balance sheets for the year ended 
December 31, 2014, and the related combined statements of income, 
stockholders&#146; equity and cash flows for the years then ended. &nbsp;The 
decision to appoint Scrudato &amp; Co. CPA was approved by Bravo Multinational 
Incorporated board of directors.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">During our two 
most recent fiscal years and any subsequent interim period prior to the 
engagement of Scrudato &amp; Co. CPA, neither Bravo Multinational Incorporated 
nor anyone on our behalf consulted with Scrudato regarding either (i) the 
application of accounting principles to a specified transaction, either 
completed or proposed; or the type of audit opinion that might be rendered on 
our financial statements, and either a written report was provided to Bravo 
Multinational Incorporated or oral advice was provided that the new accountant 
concluded was an important factor considered by Bravo Multinational Incorporated
in reaching a decision as to the accounting, auditing or financial reporting 
issue; or (ii) any matter that was either the subject of a disagreement (as 
defined in paragraph 304(a)(1)(iv) and the related instructions to Regulation S-
K) or a reportable event (as described in paragraph 304(a)(1)(v) of Regulation 
S-K).</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">Bravo 
Multinational Incorporated provided Uniack with a copy of the disclosures it 
made in its Current Report on Form 8-K on November 10, 2015, which Uniack 
received no later than the day that the disclosures were filed with the 
Securities and Exchange Commission. &nbsp;We requested that Uniack furnish us 
with a letter addressed to the Securities and Exchange Commission stating 
whether it agrees with the statements made by Bravo Multinational Incorporated 
in response to Item 304(a) of Regulation S-K, and, if not, stating the respects 
in which it does not agree. &nbsp;Uniack furnished the requested letter and 
agreed with the disclosure made by Bravo Multinational Incorporated. &nbsp;A
copy of Uniack&#146;s letter was filed with the Securities and Exchange 
Commission on November 16, 2015.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">The financial 
statements included in the 2015 Annual Report were audited by Scrudato &amp; Co.
CPA.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman 
Bold"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman Bold"><b>Vote Required</b></FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">The affirmative vote of a majority of the votes present 
at the annual meeting in person or by proxy and voting on the proposal is 
required to approve the ratification of Scrudato &amp; Co. CPA as our 
independent public accounting firm.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt"><BR>
</P>
<P style="margin:0pt" align=center>19</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; page-break-before:always"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">The board of 
directors has unanimously approved the appointment of Scrudato &amp; Co. CPA as 
Bravo&#146;s independent registered public accounting firm and recommends that 
the stockholders vote &#147;FOR&#148; the ratification<FONT FACE="Times New 
Roman Bold"> </FONT>of the appointment of Scrudato &amp; Co. CPA<FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman Bold"> </FONT>as Bravo&#146;s independent registered 
public accounting firm for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2016.</P>

text-indent:27.4pt" align=justify>1.08</P>
</TD><TD valign=bottom width=88.533><P style="margin:0pt; text-indent:41.4pt" 
align=justify>-0-</P>
</TD><TD valign=top width=84.133><P style="margin:0pt; padding-right:14.4pt; 
text-indent:20.7pt" align=justify>-0-</P>
</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P style="margin:0pt">________</P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-10pt; padding-
left:18pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-size:8pt">(1)</P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin:0pt; padding-left:18pt; font-size:8pt">Unless
otherwise indicated, the address for each of these stockholders is c/o Bravo 
Multinational Incorporated Co., at 590 York Road, Unit 3, Niagara On The Lake, 
Ontario, L0S 1J0, CANADA. Also, unless otherwise indicated, each person named in
the table above has the sole voting and investment power with respect to our 
shares of common stock or preferred stock which he beneficially owns.</P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-10pt; padding-
left:18pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-size:8pt">(2)</P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin:0pt; padding-left:18pt; font-
size:8pt">Beneficial ownership is determined in accordance with the rules of the
Securities and Exchange Commission. &nbsp;As of August 1, 2016, there were 
outstanding 371,300,924 shares of our common stock. &nbsp;As of August 1, 2016, 
we have 5,000,000 shares of the Series A preferred stock issued. &nbsp;Each 
share of the Series A preferred stock has voting rights equal to 100 shares of 
our common stock. &nbsp;Further, each share of the Series A preferred stock may 
be converted into 10 shares of our common stock. &nbsp;However, there are 
restrictions on the conversion rights of the Series A preferred stock as stated 
elsewhere in this Proxy Statement. &nbsp;Taken together, the holders of the 
Series A </P>
<P style="margin:0pt"><BR>
<P style="margin:0pt" align=center>20</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; page-break-before:always"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin:0pt; padding-left:18pt; font-
size:8pt">preferred stock have voting rights equal to 500,000,000 shares of our 
common stock, which number exceeds our outstanding shares of common stock on 
August 1, 2016. &nbsp;As of August 1, 2016, none of the Series A preferred stock
has been converted into shares of our common stock. &nbsp;As a result of their 
ownership of 5,000,000 shares of our Series A preferred stock and 183,936,299 
shares of our common stock in the aggregate, Messrs. Parliament, Brooks, Wolfe, 
Kaiser, Kosta, and Frydman, and Bravo Gaming Corporation, the &#147;controlling 
stockholders,&#148; have voting control over 683,936,299 shares of our common 
stock, which number exceeds our outstanding shares of common stock on August 1, 
2016. &nbsp;Therefore, the controlling stockholders, as a group, have voting 
control over all matters which may be acted upon by our stockholders. 
&nbsp;There are no voting agreements among the controlling stockholders, other 
than the voting agreement between Messrs. Wolfe and Frydman discussed below.</P>

left:18pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-size:8pt">(3)</P>

Parliament is our chairman of the board of the directors, chief executive 
officer, president and a director.</P>

due to personal reasons.</P>

executive officer, and president, and a former director. &nbsp;Mr. Pierre 
Quilliam and Mrs. Denise Quilliam are married. &nbsp;Although technically, under
the rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission, the shares of our common 
stock owned by Mr. and Mrs. Christian Quilliam and Mrs. Pascale Quilliam Tutt, 
are not controlled by Mr. and Mrs. Pierre Quilliam, footnotes (14), (15), and 
(16), in the past all of the shares described in the referenced footnotes have 
been voted as dictated by Pierre Quilliam. &nbsp;Consequently, we regard the 
owners of the shares described in footnotes (14), (15), and (16) as affiliates 
of Pierre Quilliam. &nbsp;Therefore, taken together, the shares described in the
referenced footnotes along with the shares described in footnotes (12), (18), 
(19), (20), (21), (22), and (23), provide Pierre Quilliam with voting control 
over 58,983,630 shares of our common stock, which number represents 22.76% of 
our outstanding shares of common stock.</P>

secretary, at 3419 Virginia Beach Boulevard, Unit 252, Virginia Beach, Virginia 
23452, telephone (716) 803-0621, or email him at 
info@bravomultinational.com.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">As of the date 
of this Proxy Statement, management has undertaken a review of the issuance of 
shares of our common stock prior to September 25, 2015, to determine if any of 
the shares were issued without proper authorization of inadequate consideration.
&nbsp;Once our examination has been completed the above table of stockholders 
may be modified.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">As a result of 
the common stock and preferred stock ownership by Messrs. Parliament, Brooks, 
Wolfe, Kaiser, Kosta, and Frydman, and Bravo Gaming Corporation, the 
&#147;controlling stockholders&#148; herein, they will be able to control all 
matters requiring stockholder approval including the election of directors, 
merger or consolidation. &nbsp;This concentration of ownership may delay, deter 
or prevent acts which could reduce the market price of our common stock.</P>

<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt" align=center><B>EXECUTIVE 
COMPENSATION</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:8.35pt"><B>Summary of Cash and Certain 
Other Compensation</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:8.35pt; text-indent:36pt">At present, 
Bravo Multinational has four executive officers. &nbsp;Beginning in March 2015, 
the compensation program for our executives consists of three key elements:</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; text-indent:-
36pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:36pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">A base salary;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; text-indent:-
36pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:36pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">Additional compensation; and</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; text-indent:-
36pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:36pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">Periodic grants and/or options of our common 
stock.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:8.35pt; text-indent:36pt"><I>Base 
Salary</I>. &nbsp;Our executive officers receive compensation based on such 
factors as competitive industry salaries, a subjective assessment of the 
contribution and experience of the officer, and the specific recommendation by 
our board of directors.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:8.35pt; text-indent:36pt"><I>Additional 
Compensation</I>. &nbsp;Each of our officers receives additional compensation as
provided in the officer&#146;s employment agreement. &nbsp;All payments to 
officers must be approved by our board of directors or compensation committee
based on the individual officer&#146;s performance and company performance.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:8.35pt; text-indent:36pt"><I>Stock 
Incentive</I>. &nbsp;Stock grants and options are awarded to executive officers 
based on their positions and individual performance. &nbsp;Stock grants and 
options provide incentive for the creation of stockholder value over the long 
term and aid significantly in the recruitment and retention of executive 
officers. &nbsp;The board of directors or compensation committee considers the 
recommendations of the chief executive officer for stock grants and options to 
executive officers (other than the chief executive officer) and approves, 
disapproves or modifies such recommendation. &nbsp;Stock grants and options for 
our executive officers will be recommended and approved by our board of 
directors.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:8.35pt"><B>Summary Compensation 
Table</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:8.35pt; text-indent:36pt">The following 
table sets forth compensation for our named executive officers for the two 
completed fiscal years ended December 31, 2015, and December 31, 2014:</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:8.35pt"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt" align=center>23</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; page-break-before:always"><BR></P>

<U>Principal Position</U></B></P>
</TD><TD valign=bottom width=37><P style="line-height:8pt; margin:0pt; font-
size:8pt" align=center><B><U>Year</U></B></P>
</TD><TD valign=bottom width=51.733><P style="line-height:8pt; margin:0pt; font-

</TD><TD valign=bottom width=42.867><P style="line-height:8pt; margin:0pt; font-

</TD><TD valign=bottom width=80.267><P style="line-height:8pt; margin:0pt; font-

<U>($)</U></B></P>
</TD><TD valign=bottom width=77.267><P style="line-height:8pt; margin:0pt; font-
size:8pt" align=center><B>Nonqualified</B></P>
<P style="line-height:8pt; margin:0pt; font-size:8pt" 
align=center><B>deferred</B></P>
<P style="line-height:8pt; margin:0pt; font-size:8pt" 
align=center><B>compensation</B></P>

<P style="line-height:10pt; margin:0pt; font-size:8pt">__________</P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-10pt; font-
size:8pt">(1)</P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin:0pt; text-indent:18.7pt; font-size:8pt">Mr. 
Pierre Quilliam was our former chairman of the board of directors, chief 
executive officer, and president, and a former director.</P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-10pt; padding-
left:18pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-size:8pt">(2)</P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin:0pt; padding-left:18pt; font-size:8pt">Mr. 
Allen Breitkreuz was our former chief operating officer and a former 
director.</P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-10pt; padding-
left:18pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-size:8pt">(3)</P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin:0pt; padding-left:18pt; font-size:8pt">Mr. 
Christian Quilliam was one of our former officers. &nbsp;Mr. Christian Quilliam 
is the son of Mr. Pierre Quilliam.</P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-10pt; padding-
left:18pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-size:8pt">(4)</P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin:0pt; padding-left:18pt; font-size:8pt">Mr. 
Thomas C Ridenour was our former chief financial officer and a former 
director.</P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-10pt; padding-
left:18pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-size:8pt">(5)</P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin:0pt; padding-left:18pt; font-size:8pt">Mr. 
Parliament is our chief executive officer, president, and chairman of the 
board.</P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-10pt; padding-
left:18pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-size:8pt">(6)</P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin:0pt; padding-left:18pt; font-size:8pt">Mr. 
Wolfe is our chief financial officer, and director. &nbsp;Mr. Wolfe will not 
stand for reelection as a director.</P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-10pt; padding-
left:18pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-size:8pt">(7)</P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin:0pt; padding-left:18pt; font-size:8pt">Mr. 
Brooks is our vice president and director</P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-10pt; padding-
left:18pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-size:8pt">(8)</P>
<P style="line-height:10pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:8pt; padding-
left:18pt; font-size:8pt">Mr. Kaiser is our corporate secretary and governance 
officer, and a nominee for director..</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; text-indent:-
36pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:36pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">Mr. Pierre Quilliam&#146;s compensation was determined, 
using industry standard comparable computations.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; text-indent:-
36pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:36pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">Mr. Allen Breitkreuz&#146; compensation was determined, 
using industry standard comparable computations.</FONT></P>

36pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:36pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">Mr. Christian Quilliam&#146;s compensation was 
determined, using standard comparable computations.</FONT></P>

36pt; font-family:Symbol"><FONT FACE="Symbol">&#183;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; padding-left:36pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">Mr. Thomas C. Ridenour&#146;s compensation was

<P style="margin-top:3.45pt; margin-bottom:8.35pt; text-indent:35.3pt">All 2015 
current executive compensation has been calculated using standard comparable 
computations then adjusted to reflect the reasonable current economic condition 
of Bravo Multinational Incorporated; please note the extreme decrease in wages 
for the current management in comparison to the previous management.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:8.35pt"><B>Outstanding Equity Awards at 
Fiscal Year-End</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:8.35pt; text-indent:36pt">None.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:8.35pt"><B>Employment Agreements</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:8.35pt; text-indent:36pt">As of August 
1, 2016, Bravo Multinational Incorporated has employment agreements with Paul 
Parliament, our chairman of the board of directors, chief executive officer, and
president, Martin Wolfe, our chief financial officer, principal accounting 
officer, and treasurer, Douglas Brooks, our Vice- President, and Richard Kaiser,
our Secretary and Corporate Governance Officer.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:8.35pt; text-indent:36pt"><I>Paul 
Parliament Employment Agreement.</I> &nbsp;On March 24, 2015, Bravo 
Multinational Incorporated and Paul Parliament executed an employment agreement,
which provides for a term of two years, and a base salary of $42,000 per year, 
payable in equal monthly installments of $3,500 paid in S-8 shares of Bravo 
common stock on the 1st day of each month during the term of Mr. 
Parliament&#146;s employment, pro rated for any partial employment period. 
&nbsp;Mr. Parliament is to devote full time hours per week of his time and 
attention to the performance of his duties of Bravo Multinational 
Incorporated.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:8.35pt"><BR>
<P style="margin:0pt" align=center>24</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; page-break-before:always"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:8.35pt; text-indent:36pt">In addition to
the base compensation, Mr. Parliament shall be entitled to receive additional 
compensation of $108,000 per year, payable in equal monthly installments of 
$9,000 paid in S-8 shares of our common stock on the 1st day of each month 
during the term of Mr. Parliament&#146;s employment, pro rated for any partial 
employment period.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:8.35pt; text-indent:36pt"><I>Douglas 
Brooks Employment Agreement.</I> &nbsp;On September 25, 2015, Bravo 
Multinational Incorporated and Douglas Brooks executed an employment agreement, 
which provides for a term of two years, and a base salary of $42,000 per year, 
payable in equal monthly installments of $3,500 paid in the S-8 shares of Bravo 
common stock on the 1st day of each month during the term of Mr. Brooks&#146; 
employment, pro rated for any partial employment period. &nbsp;Mr. Brooks is to 
devote part of his time and attention to the performance of his duties of 
Bravo.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:8.35pt; text-indent:36pt">In addition to
the base compensation, Mr. Brooks shall be entitled to receive additional 
compensation of $78,000 per year, payable in equal monthly installments of 
$6,500 paid in S-8 shares of our common stock on the 1st day of each month 
during the term of Mr. Brooks&#146; employment, pro rated for any partial 
employment period.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:8.35pt; text-indent:36pt"><I>Martin 
Wolfe Employment Agreement.</I> &nbsp;On March 24, 2015, Bravo Multinational 
Incorporated and Martin Wolfe executed an employment agreement, which provides 
for a term of one year, and a base salary of $42,000 per year, payable in equal 
monthly installments of $3,500 paid in S-8 shares of Bravo common stock on the 
1st day of each month during the term of Mr. Wolfe&#146;s employment, pro rated 
for any partial employment period. &nbsp;Mr. Wolfe is to devote part of his time
and attention to the performance of his duties of Bravo.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:8.35pt; text-indent:36pt">In addition to
the base compensation, Mr. Wolfe shall be entitled to receive additional 
compensation of $58,000 per year, payable in equal monthly installments of 
$4,833.33 paid in S-8 shares of our common stock on the 1st day of each month 
during the term of Mr. Wolfe&#146;s employment, pro rated for any partial 
employment period. This contract was revised on March 31, 2016 to provide for an
increase to $78,000 per year, payable in equal monthly installments of $6,500.00
paid in S-8 shares of our common stock on the 1st of each month for a term of 
one year.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:8.35pt; text-indent:36pt"><I>Richard 
Kaiser Employment Agreement.</I> &nbsp;On March 24, 2015, Bravo Multinational 
Incorporated and Richard Kaiser executed an employment agreement, which provides
for a term of two years, and a base salary of $42,000 per year, payable in equal
monthly installments of $3,500 paid in S-8 shares of Bravo common stock on the 
1st day of each month during the term of Mr. Kaiser&#146;s employment, pro rated
for any partial employment period. &nbsp;Mr. Kaiser is to devote part of his 
time and attention to the performance of his duties of Bravo.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:8.35pt; text-indent:36pt">In addition to
the base compensation, Mr. Kaiser shall be entitled to receive additional 
compensation of $38,000 per year, payable in equal monthly installments of 
$3,166.67 paid in S-8 shares of our common stock on the 1st day of each month 
during the term of Mr. Kaiser&#146;s employment, pro rated for any partial 
employment period. &nbsp;The contract was revised on March 31, 2016, to provide 
for an increase to $78,000 per year, payable in equal monthly installments of 
$6,500 paid in S-8 shares of our common stock on the 1st of each month for a 
term of one year.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:8.35pt; text-indent:36pt">You may obtain
copies of the employment agreements with Messrs. Parliament, Brooks, Wolfe, and 
Kaiser at www.sec.gov or by clicking on the Securities and Exchange Commission 
Filings link on the Investor Relations section of our website at 
www.bravomultinational.com, or by contacting Mr. Richard Kaiser, our corporate 
secretary, at 3419 Virginia Beach Boulevard, Unit 252, Virginia Beach, Virginia 
23452, telephone (716) 803-0621, or email him atinfo@bravomultinational.com.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:8.35pt; text-indent:36pt">All of the 
above referenced S-8 shares are to be registered on an S-8 registration 
statement filed with the SEC.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:8.35pt"><B>Director Compensation</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:8.35pt; text-indent:36pt">As a result of
the election of Mr. Brooks as a director of Bravo, Mr. Brooks was awarded 
2,000,000 shares of the restricted common stock of Bravo. &nbsp;Moreover, due to
his election as a director of Bravo, Mr. Brooks made a $100,000 direct 
investment in Bravo on October 1, 2015, in exchange for a convertible promissory
note, providing for conversion rights into common stock of Bravo based on 
Bravo&#146;s common stock price low as of September 23, 2015, which was $0.0212 
per share. &nbsp;You may obtain a copy of the convertible promissory note 
executed by Bravo at www.sec.gov or by clicking on the Securities and Exchange 
Commission Filings link on the Investor Relations section of our website at 
www.bravomultinational.com, or by contacting Mr. Richard Kaiser, our corporate 
secretary, at 3419 Virginia Beach Boulevard, Unit 252, Virginia Beach, Virginia 
23452, telephone (716) 803-0621, or email him at 
info@bravomultinational.com.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:8.35pt"><BR>
<P style="margin:0pt" align=center>25</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:8.35pt; text-indent:36pt">At the meeting
of the board of directors of Bravo held on September 25, 2015, the board of 
directors voted that any new director elected to the board of directors of Bravo
shall receive $25,000 per year in shares of our common stock registered pursuant
to a registration statement on Form S-8 filed with the SEC to be paid quarterly.
In addition, any new director shall be required to make a direct investment of 
not less than $100,000 into Bravo in exchange for a convertible promissory note 
to be submitted to the board of directors for approval.</P>

Bold"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman Bold"><B>Equity Compensation 
Plans</B></FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt"><FONT

December 31, 2015.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt" align=center><B>CERTAIN 
RELATIONSHIPS AND RELATED TRANSACTIONS</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">Other than as

transactions between various officers, directors and affiliates of Bravo 
Multinational Incorporated.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:72pt; text-indent:-
18pt; font-family:Symbol">&nbsp;</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:12pt" align=center><B>SECTION 16(a) 
BENEFICIAL OWNERSHIP REPORTING COMPLIANCE</B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">Section 16(a) of
the Exchange Act requires our directors, executive officers and persons who own 
more than 10 percent of a registered class of our equity securities, to file 
with the Securities and Exchange Commission initial reports of ownership and 
reports of changes in ownership of our equity securities. &nbsp;Officers, 
directors and greater than 10 percent stockholders are required by Securities 
and Exchange Commission regulation to furnish us with copies of all Section 
16(a) forms they file.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">Based solely 
upon a review of copies of such forms filed on Forms 3, 4, and 5, and amendments
thereto furnished to us, we believe that as of August 1, 2016, all of our 
executive officers, directors and greater than 10 percent beneficial owners have
complied on a timely basis with all Section 16(a) filing requirements.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman Bold" 
align=center><FONT FACE="Times New Roman Bold"><B>FORM 10-K 
EXHIBITS</B></FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt"><FONT 
FACE="Times New Roman">Bravo has included with this Proxy Statement a copy of 
our Form 10-K/A, the 2015 Annual Report, which is part of the Annual Report for 
our fiscal year ended December 31, 2015, including financial statements, 
schedules, and a list of exhibits. &nbsp;Bravo will mail without charge, upon 
written request, a copy of our Form 10-K exhibits. &nbsp;Requests should be sent
to Mr. Richard Kaiser, the corporate secretary of Bravo Multinational 
Incorporated, at 3419 Virginia Beach Boulevard, Unit 252, Virginia Beach, 
Virginia 23452, telephone (716) 803-0621, or email him at 
info@bravomultinational.com. &nbsp;Our Form 10-K exhibits are also available, 
free of charge, at the Securities and Exchange Commission&#146;s web site, 
www.sec.gov.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman Bold" 
align=center><FONT FACE="Times New Roman Bold"><b>REQUIREMENTS, INCLUDING 
DEADLINES, FOR SUBMISSION OF PROXY<BR>
PROPOSALS, NOMINATION OF DIRECTORS AND OTHER BUSINESS OF 
STOCKHOLDERS</b></FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt">Stockholder 
proposals submitted pursuant to Rule 14a-8 of the Exchange Act for inclusion in 
our Proxy Materials for our 2017 Annual Meeting of stockholders must be received
by Mr. Richard Kaiser, our corporate secretary, at 3419 Virginia Beach 
Boulevard, Unit 252, Virginia Beach, Virginia 23452, or email him at 
info@bravomultinational.com. &nbsp;The deadline is calculated in the following 
manner if the proposal is submitted for a regularly scheduled annual meeting. 
&nbsp;The proposal must be received at our principal executive offices not less 
than 120 calendar days before the date of Bravo&#146;s proxy statement released 
to our stockholders in connection with the previous year&#146;s annual meeting. 
&nbsp;However, if Bravo did not hold an annual meeting the previous year, or if 
the date of this year&#146;s annual meeting has been changed by more than 30 
days from the date of the previous year&#146;s meeting, then the deadline is a 
reasonable time before Bravo begins to print and send the Proxy Materials. 
&nbsp;The deadline to submit a proposal for inclusion in our proxy materials for
the 2016 Annual Meeting has passed.</P>

persons named in the proxies will vote upon such matters in accordance with 
their best judgment.</FONT></P>

directors hopes that you will attend the 2016 Annual Meeting. &nbsp;Whether or 
not you plan to attend the 2016 Annual Meeting, you are urged to complete, date,
sign and return the enclosed proxy in the accompanying envelope, or vote via the
Internet or by telephone at your earliest convenience. &nbsp;If you attend the 
annual meeting, you can still vote your stock personally even though you may 
have already sent in your proxy.</P>
